item.description:
V2.0.3

  • Fixed an issue where volume would play when it was set to zero.

V2.0.2

  • Version 2 had an issue where adjusting the volume with the Touch Bar would lag a lot. This should now be resolved.

V2.0.1

  • Fixed an issue where the app would crash if dynamic width setting is modified

V2.0.0

This marks Version 2 of MediaMate, with a bunch of improvements to the core of the app, along with some new features. I hope you like it!

Good news: Monterey still supported ðŸ‘€

New Features

  • Themes: Set your preferred style for the Volume, Display and Keyboard HUD. Choose between Classic (from v1) and a new iOS-styled theme!
  • Reworked & Simplified Settings: The amount of settings has been reduced by a great amount, while still providing customization for those who want it.
  • Change the volume and brightness by click-dragging or two finger dragging on the visible HUD (iOS Theme only)
  • Touchbar & External app compatibility mode got a boost: it is more reliable and no custom profile is needed anymore.
  • A new, improved Demo Mode has landed, which allows longer testing periods.
  • The old Media Progress Bar has been replaced by a fancy new one, which resembles the new iOS 16 look.
  • Touch Bar detection on first launch of the app.

Improvements

  • Reworked icons for Volume, Brightness and Keyboard Brightness to more closely match the built-in ones, while also improving their animations.
  • All HUDs are now shown on the lock screen by default.
  • The Classic Theme has a better size on large displays.
  • The HUD preview will now hide when the settings window isn't in focus.
  • Alternate looks for HUDs, such as placing them at the top or the side, have a more refined look.
  • The Brightness HUD won't be triggered anymore by auto-brightness adjusting the display.
  • The HUDs will disappear faster.
  • App Size is 14% smaller (compared to 1.4.4)
  • Improved Memory Management

Bugfixes

  • Fixed an issue where some system settings would be reset after setting the volume sound in MediaMate settings.
  • Overshoot works properly for keyboard brightness.
  • Fixed an issue where the keyboard brightness icon could be displayed wrongly.
  • Fixed an issue where the settings window would shake on first launch.
  • Fixed an issue where empty menubar items could appear on Ventura.
  • Fixed some UI glitches.

V2.0.2

  • Version 2 had an issue where adjusting the volume with the Touch Bar would lag a lot. This should now be resolved.

V2.0.1

  • Fixed an issue where the app would crash if dynamic width setting is modified

V2.0.0

Good news: Monterey still supported ðŸ‘€

  • Reworked & Simplified Settings: The amount of settings has been reduced by a great amount, while still providing customization for those who want it.

  • The Classic Theme has a better size on large displays.

  • Alternate looks for HUDs, such as placing them at the top or the side, have a more refined look.
  • The Brightness HUD won't be triggered anymore by auto-brightness adjusting the display.
  • The HUDs will disappear faster.
  • App Size is 14% smaller (compared to 1.4.4)
  • Improved Memory Management

  • Overshoot works properly for keyboard brightness.
  • Fixed an issue where the keyboard brightness icon could be displayed wrongly.
  • Fixed an issue where the settings window would shake on first launch.
  • Fixed an issue where empty menubar items could appear on Ventura.
  • Fixed some UI glitches.

V2.0.1

  • Fixed an issue where the app would crash if dynamic width setting is modified

V2.0.0

This marks Version 2 of MediaMate, with a bunch of improvements to the core of the app, along with some new features. I hope you like it!

Good news: Monterey still supported ðŸ‘€

  • Reworked & Simplified Settings: The amount of settings has been reduced by a great amount, while still providing customization for those who want it.
  • Change the volume and brightness by click-dragging or two finger dragging on the visible HUD (iOS Theme only)
  • Touchbar & External app compatibility mode got a boost: it is more reliable and no custom profile is needed anymore.
  • A new, improved Demo Mode has landed, which allows longer testing periods.
  • The old Media Progress Bar has been replaced by a fancy new one, which resembles the new iOS 16 look.
  • Touch Bar detection on first launch of the app.

  • The Classic Theme has a better size on large displays.

This marks Version 2 of MediaMate, with a bunch of improvements to the core of the app, along with some new features. I hope you like it!

Good news: Monterey still supported ðŸ‘€

New Features

  • Themes: Set your preferred style for the Volume, Display and Keyboard HUD. Choose between Classic (from v1) and a new iOS-styled theme!
  • Reworked & Simplified Settings: The amount of settings has been reduced by a great amount, while still providing customization for those who want it.
  • Change the volume and brightness by click-dragging or two finger dragging on the visible HUD (iOS Theme only)
  • Touchbar & External app compatibility mode got a boost: it is more reliable and no custom profile is needed anymore.
  • A new, improved Demo Mode has landed, which allows longer testing periods.
  • The old Media Progress Bar has been replaced by a fancy new one, which resembles the new iOS 16 look.
  • Touch Bar detection on first launch of the app.

Improvements

  • Reworked icons for Volume, Brightness and Keyboard Brightness to more closely match the built-in ones, while also improving their animations.
  • All HUDs are now shown on the lock screen by default.
  • The Classic Theme has a better size on large displays.
  • The HUD preview will now hide when the settings window isn't in focus.
  • Alternate looks for HUDs, such as placing them at the top or the side, have a more refined look.
  • The Brightness HUD won't be triggered anymore by auto-brightness adjusting the display.
  • The HUDs will disappear faster.
  • App Size is 14% smaller (compared to 1.4.4)
  • Improved Memory Management

Bugfixes

  • Fixed an issue where some system settings would be reset after setting the volume sound in MediaMate settings.
  • Overshoot works properly for keyboard brightness.
  • Fixed an issue where the keyboard brightness icon could be displayed wrongly.
  • Fixed an issue where the settings window would shake on first launch.
  • Fixed an issue where empty menubar items could appear on Ventura.
  • Fixed some UI glitches.

Important Note:

This is probably the last version that supports macOS Monterey. Unless serious bugs pop up, this macOS version won't receive updates for MediaMate anymore.

New Features

  • Added "Reveal on Play" and "Reveal on Media Change" options to the Now Playing HUD. These allow further control for when the HUD should pop up.
  • Preparation for V2 release.

Improvements

  • Clarified the "Reveal when playing app is active" Setting.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed an issue where "Reveal on Menubar click" would not work properly when "Reveal on Pause" was disabled.
  • Fixed a regression where the volume icon would not animate when disabled.

Improvements

  • The settings window will shake when an incorrect license key is provided.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed an issue where external app mode wouldn't work for volume.
  • Fixed duplicated title of attached files when submitting feedback.

Improvements

  • Double-clicking to install the touchbar helper profile will now open the Profiles settings pane.

Bugfixes

  • Fixes an issue where opening System Preferences would not show the correct pane on macOS Monterey.

Bugfixes

  • Fixes an issue where the HUDs would be behind other windows on certain macs.

Previous Release

Improvements

The keyboard shortcuts will now follow the standard macOS ones:

  • âŒ¥ + key will open the specific settings
  • âŒ¥ + â‡§ + key will make more granular changes
  • â‡§ + key makes a sound (Volume only)
  • â‡§ + âŒ˜ + key will min/max
  • âŒƒ + brightness key + any of the above commands will apply to keyboard brightness.

The previous customization of these controls has been removed due to the unneeded complexity.

Improvements

The keyboard shortcuts will now follow the standard macOS ones:

  • âŒ¥ + key will open the specific settings
  • âŒ¥ + â‡§ + key will make more granular changes
  • â‡§ + key makes a sound (Volume only)
  • â‡§ + âŒ˜ + key will min/max
  • âŒƒ + brightness key + any of the above commands will apply to keyboard brightness.

The previous customization of these controls has been removed due to the unneeded complexity.

New Features

  • Say hi to Focus Filters! Hide HUDs when you're in a certain focus, e.g. don't show the Now Playing HUD when you're in Do Not Disturb. (macOS 13.0+)

Improvements

  • Internal rewrite.

New Features

  • Option to not show the Now Playing HUD when the playing application is the frontmost application.
  • Option to hide the album artwork for specific apps. (This will also stop MediaMate from trying to fetch one and showing a spinner)

Improvements

  • Architectural improvements of app.

Bugfixes

  • Fixes an issue where the volume would not mute on low volume.
  • Fixes an issue where the Ventura settings layout would not be applied.
  • Fixes an issue where the HUDs would not be visible or chopped of in tryout mode.

New Features

  • Option to not show the Now Playing HUD when the media is paused.

Improvements

  • The close button on the Now Playing HUD will only be shown when needed. (e.g. not on the lockscreen)
  • The pause button color on the Now Playing HUD will match the accent color

Bugfixes

  • Fixes an issue where the HUDs would not reposition after a resolution change.
  • Fixes an issue where the Volume/Brightness HUD is to narrow on lower resolution displays.
  • Fixes "On Keypress" for Now Playing on Lockscreen
  • Fixes an issue where the allowlist for now playing would not work with Safari
  • Fixes an issue where the Volume HUD would incorrectly state the volume as muted.
  • Fixes an issue where the app would crash if Spotify played a local file.

New Features

  • Basic support for external apps (e.g. MonitorControl, Lunar) in Sync Mode (Beta).
  • New more reliable method to disable the native HUDs on touchbar macbooks.
  • Option to reveal the Now Playing HUD when the menubar item is clicked.

Improvements

  • "Center" option in the layout settings is lowered on the screen instead of the absolute center.

Bugfixes

  • Fixes an issue where the volume would hang at 50%.
  • Fixes an issue where the volume change sound would be played twice when touchbar compatibility mode is enabled.
  • Fixes an issue where the activation notice would route to the wrong tab.
  • Fixes an issue where the progress bar in the Now Playing HUD would be shown twice.

New Features

  • Reduced translucency option

Improvements

  • The close button on the Now Playing HUD is more in line with the default macOS style.
  • Added a "full log" option when sending feedback.

Bugfixes

  • Fixes an issue where launch at login would not work on Monterey
  • Fixes (hopefully) an issue where the app would quit unexpectedly when the menubar icon is hidden.
  • Fixes an issue where there would be small white lines around HUDs on Monterey

New Features:

  • HUD for Keyboard Brightness
  • Quick Keys: Quickly put Brightness of display and keyboard to min/max using their keys + a modifier key (â‡§, âŒƒ, âŒ¥, âŒ˜)
  • Simulate Keyboard Brightness Keys: If your macbook doesn't have Keyboard Brightness Keys, you can now control them with the Brightness Keys + modifier (â‡§, âŒƒ, âŒ¥, âŒ˜)
  • Control the Volume Feedback Sound with a modifier key (like the default macOS behavior)
  • Quickly open the expanded Now Playing HUD with a keyboard shortcut
  • Provide Feedback through the app.
  • Disable dynamic width of the Now Playing HUD
  • Disable dynamic Font Size of the Now Playing HUD
  • Check for Updates button is visible in the Settings Window.
  • App version and build number are visible in the Settings Window.

Improvements:

  • The default shape of the Now Playing HUD has been changed to "Squared"
  • Moved lots of settings around so they are more logically placed.
  • Brightness HUD and Volume HUD now have the same height (yes, they were slightly off!)
  • Volume HUD bar is now empty when the volume is muted.

Bugfixes:

  • Fixed an issue where the menubar wouldn't be clickable if the menubar icon was hidden.
  • Fixed (hopefully) an issue where the app would quit if the menubar icon was hidden.
  • Fixed an issue where the HUDs would not be centered if the dock was in a vertical position.
  • Fixed an issue where Non-allowed apps would still show on the Now Playing HUD.
  • Fixed an issue where the Volume and Brightness HUD could flicker on macOS Monterey.
  • Fixed an issue where the volume change sound would be delayed.

Other

  • Disabled "Remove License" functionality in the app due to security concerns.
  • Disabled "Grow with blur" and "Shrink with blur" transitions in Monterey due to glitches.

New Features:

  • Added the default macOS transition to the brightness and volume HUD ("pop in, fade out").
  • Granular control of Volume and Brightness! Choose which modifier key you want to use (â‡§, âŒƒ, âŒ¥, âŒ˜) and choose the step size per press.
  • Choose the step size of a regular adjustment of volume and brightness.

Improvements:

  • Tweaked the touchbar compatibility mode a bit so it is more reliable (hopefully).

Bugfixes:

  • Fixes an issue where the Brightness HUD would not disappear if used with some keyboards.
  • Fixes an issue where the Now Playing HUD would not finish the disappear transition on notched macbooks.

Bugfixes:

  • Fixes an issue where someone with a registered Gumroad account would not be able to activate the app.
